image.altText: A photo showing the top of a power pole with three power lines through it.

props.synopsis: It could be a first for Australia, but would putting two state-owned entities in competition with one another push down power prices?

title.children: Would a publicly owned energy retailer make bills cheaper?

image.altText: A red billboard featuring images of Shane King MP and Mark Ryan MP.

props.synopsis: Ahead of this month's state election, several MPs from both Labor and the LNP have used their electorate and communication allowances to pay for billboards spruiking themselves.

title.children: Queensland MPs use taxpayer-funded allowances to pay for billboards of themselves

image.altText: A man next to a burnt wreckage

props.synopsis: The empty inner-Brisbane plots have become overgrown with weeds and the dilapidated buildings have attracted vandals, squatters and copper thieves.

title.children: City residents say developers neglected this site for years and now it's a burnt-out crime scene

image.altText: a pub

props.synopsis: The venue, which was renamed the Victory Hotel in 1921 after the Allies won World War I, was built in 1855 and is heritage listed as the oldest surviving pub in the city.

title.children: Brisbane's iconic Victory sign to be torn down under proposed pub revamp

image.altText: Dads and Miley

props.synopsis: Miley is the first baby to be delivered via altruistic surrogacy in the North West Queensland outback, where healthcare with a reputation as hard to access has brought a family's dreams to life.

title.children: How two sisters helped their stepbrother start a family in the ultimate act of love

image.altText: Brisbane voter at polling place

props.synopsis: Do you have to vote in a state election? And can you cast your ballot in a different electorate? We have your questions covered.

title.children: The corflutes are out and letterbox drops are underway. Here's how and when to vote in the Queensland election

image.altText: woman looks at camera in day-glow

props.synopsis: From relationship breakdowns and infidelity, to loneliness and trauma after seeing mates die at work, counsellors say the nature of mine work means mental health struggles are rife among workers.

title.children: Lani's mental health spiralled when she worked in the mining industry and her story is far too common

image.altText: a woman smiling on a beach

props.synopsis: A new study investigating the link between sleep and pain could fundamentally change the way doctors and clinicians treat people with chronic pain.

title.children: New sleep study could be 'game-changer' for millions of Australians suffering from chronic pain

image.altText: Voters must now number every square on the ballot paper.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, Queensland Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: Queensland Votes 2024 — stay up to date with the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: Fagan and cup

props.synopsis: Lions coach Chris Fagan has been spotted doing 'the most Brisbane thing ever' after taking the AFL premiership cup out during his morning walk for a coffee.

title.children: 'He had it wrapped in a towel': Lions coach Fagan spotted taking AFL cup for a walk in suburban Brisbane

image.altText: A tractor operating in field of basil on a far north Queensland herb farm

props.synopsis: Would-be premier David Crisafulli has told the state's agriculture sector that the LNP will "supercharge" farming productivity if elected, committing to a $30 million funding boost.

title.children: LNP promises $30m funding injection to Queensland's agriculture industry if elected

image.altText: A composite image of a fallen tree and a bushfire affected area

props.synopsis: Two cases of alleged fraud have been referred to police after one employee was suspended and seven contract staff were terminated at a Queensland government agency responsible for distributing disaster funding.

title.children: Fraud allegations involving Tara bushfire and Cyclone Jasper disaster funding referred to police

image.altText: Night shot of apartment buildings with smoke rising from a blast

props.synopsis: Iran has fired about 200 missiles at Israel in response to the killings of senior leaders of Hamas, Hezbollah and the Iranian Revolutionary Guards. Israel's military says the attack will have consequences. Follow live

title.children: Hezbollah says it forced some Israeli troops to retreat as Israel strikes Lebanon's capital

image.altText: The flags of Iran Lebanon and Hezbollah

props.synopsis: The missile strikes on Israel is the latest in a series of escalations in the Middle East and, unlike Iran's previous retaliation, could see the situation devolve further in a region on the brink.

title.children: In a fortnight of escalations, the Iran missile attack on Israel is unlikely to be the last one

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in courtyard

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has condemned Iran's overnight missile attack on Israel as he reiterated calls for a ceasefire to de-escalate tensions.

title.children: PM condemns Iran's strike on Israel, calls for ceasefire

image.altText: Israel's Iron Dome anti-missile system intercepts rockets

props.synopsis: Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps said the assault was in retaliation for Israeli killings of militant leaders and aggression in Lebanon against the Iran-backed armed movement Hezbollah and in Gaza.

title.children: Israel vows to make Iran 'pay' for missile attacks on Israel, raising fears of wider war

image.altText: Traffic driving along street at a new housing estate.

props.synopsis: News that Treasury was looking at modelling changes to negative gearing was treated as a scandal. But when it comes to Australia's housing affordability problem, wouldn't the real scandal be if Treasury officials WEREN'T examining every possible pullable lever?

title.children: The flawed truth about the latest negative gearing outrage

image.altText: A Virgin plane flying in the sky in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: After Qantas successfully lobbied against extra Qatar Airways flights, the Middle Eastern airline has exacted revenge on the Flying Kangaroo with a deal that will increase competition and possibly result in cheaper fares.

title.children: How Qatar outmanoeuvred Qantas on international flights

image.altText: A rally for Gaza and Lebanon in Sydney

props.synopsis: Organisers says pro-Palestinian events will go ahead in Sydney this weekend even if they are prohibited by the NSW Supreme Court as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese backs NSW Police's attempts to prevent them from happening.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian events will go ahead in Sydney even if prohibited by court, organisers say

image.altText: A composite image of two men talking

props.synopsis: Vice-presidential debates are usually low-stakes affairs. But in a US election of twists and turns, this one took on a greater significance. These were the key moments.

title.children: A deeply unpopular JD Vance had a lot to lose during the VP debate. These were the big moments

image.altText: Jenny Moncur sits at a table and looks at her mobile phone

props.synopsis: Consumers and industry stakeholders are calling for better regulation of phone companies after family members of deceased customers are repeatedly contacted – in some cases for years after a person's death.

title.children: 'Telstra has got away with it': Widow's 'unforgivable' ordeal over her dead husband's account

image.altText: A bronze statue of a man. Its head is missing.

props.synopsis: Charges against Timothy Walker, accused of removing the head of the statue of Kalgoorlie pioneer Paddy Hannan, have been dropped and the earlier conviction of Damien Wesley can now be revealed.

title.children: Bizarre statue beheading case concludes with a conviction and an acquittal

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: A woman found guilty of stealing from elderly victims over an eight-year period has been sentenced to at least five years in jail, with the judge saying the fraudster lacked "contrition" and that she had actually stolen millions more than the $270,000 over which she was charged.

title.children: 'Con artist' who swindled elderly victims of savings jailed over 'web of deceit'

image.altText: A shopping trolley full of essentials items like fruit, water, and eggs

props.synopsis: A US dock workers' strike reaching from New York to Texas is throwing global supply chains into disarray. And Australians' weekly shop will not be immune.

title.children: Why the weekly shop for many Australians could be impacted by a US dock worker strike

image.altText: A close up shot of a woman with blonde hair mid speech.

props.synopsis: The federal government claims it is "serious" about going to the polls over its unsupported housing bill, which it will reintroduce to parliament, setting up a double dissolution election trigger.

title.children: 'Serious proposition': Government moves to reintroduce failed housing bill, reviving threat of double dissolution election

image.altText: A man is led out of a house in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: Australian Federal Police allege the creator of Ghost app, used by criminals for communications had amassed millions in cryptocurrency.

title.children: Alleged Ghost app creator had millions in crypto, says AFP

image.altText: tinned peaches on a supermarket shelf

props.synopsis: Iconic Australian fruit canning company SPC has agreed to merge with the Original Juice Company in a move to shore up their future in a difficult time for manufacturers.

title.children: Canned fruit giant SPC agrees to merger to solidify Australian manufacturing

image.altText: a young noni hazlehurst reading a play school book on the set of the children's show

props.synopsis: Australian acting legend Noni Hazlehurst has had a varied and storied career. In an extract from her new memoir, Dropping the Mask, she reflects on how Play School shaped her into the person she is today.

title.children: 'I am more proud of Play School than anything else I've done': Noni Hazlehurst on the joys of her career

image.altText: A middle-aged indigenous man with curly grey hair smiles at the camera inside his office with indigenous art in background.

props.synopsis: Aboriginal clinician Darryle Barnes is no stranger to attending funerals, with his father and grandfather dying in their early 50s. As he approaches the same age, it is an outcome he is driven to change.

title.children: Darryle was sick of attending funerals so he's changing Indigenous health outcomes one GP visit at a time

image.altText: Milky Way Stars Mapped at Coonabarabran

props.synopsis: It's hoped the data collected using the Anglo-Australian Telescope near Coonabarabran will help scientists test theories about space and how our galaxy was formed.

title.children: Ever wondered what's in a star? Scientists have just mapped the chemical 'fingerprints' of a million of them

image.altText: A man with a short tight haircut and military uniform stands speaking.

props.synopsis: In candid remarks during last month's International Land Forces conference in Melbourne, visiting Brigadier General Frank J Lozano expressed confidence that a "coalition of the willing" could outpace Beijing's rising regional dominance.

title.children: Visiting US general warns 'there is a fight coming', as he stresses importance of Australian alliance

image.altText: A female jockey smiles after win on horse.

props.synopsis: Racing NSW says more women than ever are entering the sport of horse racing, invigorating a historically male-dominated industry.

title.children: No longer a 'sport of kings', female apprentices are dominating the racing industry

image.altText: Reporter wears lemon suit standing in front of Brisbane River, with graph representing seats needed to win in election.

props.synopsis: Jessica van Vonderen explains how many seats Labor and the LNP will need to govern in their own right.

title.children: Politics is a numbers game — so how many seats do Labor and the LNP need to win Queensland?
